document.docTitle: Homoneura (Homoneura) longiprocessa Li & Yang 2012, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Eleven new species of the Homoneura (Homoneura) beckeri group from Yunnan, China (Diptera, Lauxaniidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Eleven new species of the Homoneura (Homoneura) beckeri group from Yunnan, China (Diptera, Lauxaniidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Entomology, China Agricultural University, Beijing 100193, China. E-mail: dyangcau @ yahoo. com. cn & Correspondence author

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Face without spots. Antenna blackish brown. Wing without markings. Abdominal tergite 2 with a pair of blackish brown lateral posterior bands; tergites 3–6 each with a black median spot, confluent with black posterior band on tergites 3–5.
Description. MALE. Body length 3.8–4.3 mm , wing length 3.9–4.1 mm . FEMALE. Body length 3.5–4.5 mm , wing length 3.3–4.3 mm .

Head ( Fig. 9 ) pale yellow. Face without spots. Frons about as long as wide and parallel–sided, with two narrow blackish gray stripes along or rows and a narrow brown triangular median stripe extending to ocellar triangle; ocellar triangle grayish black; oc strong, about as long as anterior or , anterior or slightly shorter than posterior or . Gena about 1/6 height of eye. Occiput with a wide grayish black stripe confluent with ocellar triangle. Antenna blackish brown, 1st flagellomere 1.6 times longer than high; arista long plumose, black except brownish basally, with longest hairs longer than height of 1st flagellomere. Proboscis yellowish brown, with yellowish and blackish hairs; palpus pale yellow with blackish hairs.

Thorax ( Fig. 20 ) blackish brown with grayish white pruinescence. Mesoscutum with white pruinescence on anterior margin, 0+3 dc (anterior dc clearly behind transverse scutal suture), acr in 6 somewhat irregular rows. Anepisternum and katepisternum pale yellow with whitish gray pruinescence, and each with a grayish black spot. Scutellum brownish black except yellow apical margin, with yellowish gray pruinescence. Legs pale yellow, but all tarsi dark yellow except tarsomere 5 brown on apical half; hind tibia with an incomplete brown basal ring. Fore femur with 4 strong pv and 5 pd , ctenidium with 11–13 short bristles; fore tibia with 1 long preapical ad and 2 short apv . Mid femur with 5 a and 1 apv ; mid tibia with 1 strong preapical ad and 3 strong apv . Hind femur with 1 preapical ad ; hind tibia with 1 weak preapical ad and 1 short apv . Wing ( Fig. 31 ) slightly yellow, without markings; subcostal cell hyaline; costa with 2nd (between R 1 and R 2+3 ), 3rd (between R 2+3 and R 4+5 ) and 4th (between R 4+5 and M 1 ) sections in proportion of 1.9: 0.6: 0.4; r-m at middle of discal cell; ultimate and penultimate sections of M
1 in
proportion of 1.3: 0.8; ultimate section of CuA 1 about 1/5 of penultimate. Halter pale yellow.

Type material.
Holotype ♂ ( CAU ), CHINA ,
Yunnan Province

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 81–85.
Homoneura ( Homoneura ) longiprocessa
sp. nov.
Male. 81. protandrium and epandrium, lateral view; 82. epandrial complex, posterior view; 83. protandrium, anterior view; 84. aedeagal complex, ventral view; 85. aedeagal complex, lateral view. Scale 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The new species is somewhat similar to
Homoneura ( Homoneura ) flavida Shi &Yang
from China ( Yunnan and Hainan ) in the following characters: face without spots and parafacial brown to blackish brown, abdominal tergite 6 yellow with a small brown median spot; gonopod columniform. But it can be separated from the latter by the following features: wing without markings; protandrium with a long narrow furcated ventral process; surstylus broad, hairy, digitiform; aedeagus without distinct apical incision, and with a pair of lateral median teeth, a pair of ventral teeth and a pair of dorsal teeth. In H .
( H .) flavida
, the wing has a brown stripe on dmcu ; the surstylus is nearly knife–like; aedeagus has a distinct apical incision, the aedeagus has no distinct process (Shi & Yang 2009).
Etymology. Latin, longi -, prefix meaning long + processa , meaning process, referring to the protandrium having a long, narrow, furcated ventral process.
